data.title: Habsburg Part 2
data.text:
HABSBURG

Part 2

Rudolf I von Habsburg (1218-1291; See Part 1) was a little-known count when elected King of the Romans in 1273. After he was elected he persuaded the electors to sanction his grant of Austria and Styria to his sons, and the Habsburgs were based in Austria from then until 1918. He m.1st 1245 Gertrud (1225-Vienna 16 Feb 1281; bur Basel Münster); he m.2nd Basel6 Feb 1284 Isabelle (1270-1323), dau of Hugues IV, Duc de Bourgogne (and later wife of Pierre de Chambly)

1a) Mechtild (Rheinfelden ca 1253-Munich 23 Dec 1304; bur Kl Fürstenfeld); m.Aachen 24 Oct 1273 Duke Ludwig II of Bavaria (d.1294)

2a) Albrecht I, 1282 Duke of Austria, Styria, Carniola and the Windische Mark, 1298 German King (Jul 1255-murdered at Königsfelden 1 May 1308, bur Wettingen, then 1309 Speyer Dom); m.Vienna 1274 Elisabeth (d.Vienna 28 Oct 1313; bur Königsfelden 1316) dau.of Meinhard V Gf von Görz-Tirol

1b) Anna (1275/80-Breslau 19 Mar 1327; bur St.Anna Kloster, Breslau); m.1st Graz Oct 1295 Mgve Hermann of Brandenburg (d.1 Feb 1308); m.2nd 1310 Duke Heinrich VI of Breslau (d.24 Nov 1335)

2b) Agnes (18 May 1281-Königsfelden10 Jun 1364, bur there); m.Vienna 13 Feb 1296 King Andrew III of Hungary (d.Ofen 14 Jan 1301)

3b) Rudolf III, Duke of Austria and Styria 1298/1306, King of Bohemia 1307 (ca 1282-Horazdiowitz 4 Jul 1307, bur St.Veit, Prague); m.1st 25 May 1300 Blanche (d.Vienna 19 Mar 1305, bur Vienna Minoritenkirche), dau of King Philippe III of France; m.2nd shortly after 8 Sep 1306 Ryksa Elzbieta (1 Sep 1288-Königgrätz 19 Oct 1335, bur Brünn), dau of King Przemysl of Bohemia, and widow of King Wenzel II of Bohemia

1c) [ex 1] a dau., d.young

4b) Friedrich I “der Schöne”, Duke of Austria & Styria 1306, German King 1314 (1289-Gutenstein 13 Jan 1330, bur Mauerbach, then 1783 St.Stephan, Vienna); m.Ravensburg 11 May 1315 Isabella (1305-12 Jul 1330; bur Vienna Minoritenkirche), dau of King Jaime II of Aragón and Sicily

1c) Friedrich (1316-1322, bur Königsfelden)

2c) Elisabeth (1317-23 Oct 1336, bur Mauerbach, then 1783 St.Stephan, Vienna)

3c) Anna (1318-Vienna 14 Dec 1343, where she was abbess of St.Klara; bur St.Klara); m.1st by 21 Sep 1328 Duke Heinrich III of Bavaria (d.18 Jun 1333); m.2nd 29 Sep 1336 Johann Heinrich Gf von Görz (d.Trieste 17 Mar 1338)

4c) [illegitimate] Friedrich, a priest at Groß-Weikersdorf 1331

5c) [illegitimate] Friedrich, a priest at Mödling 1334

6c) [illegitimate] Offmei, a priest in Tulln fl 1319/27

5b) Leopold I, Duke of Austria & Styria 1306 (4 Aug 1290-Strassburg28 Feb 1326, bur Königsfelden); m.Basel 26 May 1315 Catherine (d.Rheinfelden 30 Sep 1336, bur Königsfelden), dau of Ct Amadeus V of Savoy

1c) Katharina (9 Feb 1320-d.of the plague 28 Sep 1349, bur Königsfelden); m.1st ca 1338 Enguerrand VI de Coucy (k.a.Crécy 25 Aug 1346); m.2nd 1348 Konrad Bggf von Magdeburg (d.25 Sep 1349)

2c) Agnes (1321/6-Schweidnitz 2 Feb 1392, bur Schweidnitz Minoritenkirche); m.after 1 Jun 1338 Duke Bolko II of Schweidnitz (d.28 Jul 1368, bur Grüssau)

6b) Albrecht II "der Weise" Gf von Pfirt 1324, Duke of Austria, Styria, Carinthia, Carniola & South Tyrol 1330 (Habsburg 12 Dec 1298-Vienna 20 Jul 1358, bur Gaming); m.15 Feb 1324 Johanna Gfn von Pfirt (d.Vienna 15 Jan 1352), dau of Ulrich Gf von Pfirt

1c) Rudolf IV, Duke of Austria, Styria, Carinthia & Carniola 1358, Ct of Tyrol 1363 (Vienna 1 Nov 1339-d.of the plague in Milan 27 Jul 1365; bur St.Stephan, Vienna); m.Vienna 13 Jul 1356 Katharina of Bohemia [Luxemburg] (Prague Aug 1342-Perchtoldsdorf 26 Apr 1395), dau of Emperor Karl IV, and later wife of Duke Otto of Bavaria, Mgve of Brandenburg)

2c) Katharina, Abbess of St. Klara, Vienna (1342-10 Jan 1381; bur St.Klara, Vienna)

3c) Margarete (Vienna 1346-Brünn 14 Jan 1366; bur Kl St.Thomas, Brünn); m.1st Passau 4 Sep 1359 Meinhard III Gf von Tirol, Duke in Bavaria (d.Schloß Tirol 13 Jan 1363); m.2nd Vienna 1364 Mgve Johann Heinrich of Moravia [Luxemburg] (d.12 Nov 1375)

4c) Friedrich III (Vienna31 Mar 1347-d.on a hunt in Vienna10 Dec 1362; bur St.Stephan, Vienna)

5c) Albrecht III, Duke of Austria & Styria 1365, in Inner-Istria and the Windische Mark 1374 (Vienna 9 Sep 1348-Laxenburg 29 Aug 1395, bur St.Stephan, Vienna); m.1st after 19 Mar 1366 Elisabeth of Bohemia [Luxemburg] (Prague 19 Mar 1358-Vienna 4 Sep 1373; bur Gaming), dau of Emperor Karl IV; m.2nd Vienna 4 Mar 1375 Beatrix (ca 1362-Perchtoldsdorf 10 Jun 1414; bur St.Stephan, Vienna), dau of Fridrich V Bggf von Nürnberg

1d) Albrecht IV, Duke of Austria (Vienna21 Sep 1377-Klosterneuburg14 Sep 1404; bur St.Stephan, Vienna); m.Vienna 24 Apr 1390 Johanna (1377-Vienna 15 Jun 1410; bur St.Stephan, Vienna), dau of Duke Albrecht of Bavaria, Ct of Holland

1e) Margarete (Vienna26 Jun 1395-Burghausen24 Dec 1447; bur Raitenhaslach); m.Landshut 25 Nov 1412 Duke Heinrich of Bavaria (d.30 Jul 1450)

2e) Albrecht V, Duke of Austria 1404, German King 1438, crowned as King of Bohemia 1438 (Vienna10 Aug 1397-Langendorf27 Oct 1439, bur Stuhlweissenburg); m.Vienna 26 Apr 1422 Elisabeth of Bohemia [Luxemburg] (Prague28 Feb 1409-Raab19 Dec 1442, bur Stuhlweissenburg), dau of Emperor Sigismund

1f) Georg (1431-16 Feb 1435; bur St.Stephan, Vienna)

2f) Anna (Vienna12 Apr 1432-Eckartsberga13 Nov 1462, bur Reinhardsbrunn); m.Jena 20 Jun 1446 Duke Wilhelm III of Saxony (d.Weimar 17 Sep 1482)

3f) Elisabeth (1435/6-Cracow 30 Aug 1505, bur Cracow Cathedral); m.Cracow 10 Mar 1454 King Kazimierz IV of Poland (d.Grodno 7 Jun 1492)

4f) Ladislaus, Duke of Austria at birth, crowned as King of [Hungary and] Bohemia 1453 (Komorn, Hungary22 Feb 1440-Prague23 Nov 1457, bur St.Veit, Prague)

6c) Leopold III, Duke of Austria & Styria 1365; then his brother took Austria 1379 and he became Duke in Styria, Carinthia, Carniola and Istria, Ct of Tyrol, etc (Vienna 1 Nov 1351-k.a.Sempach 9 Jul 1386, bur Königsfelden); m.Vienna 23 Feb 1365 Viridis (ca 1350-Sittich, Carniola by 11 Mar 1414, bur there), dau of Barnabo Visconti, Lord of Milan

1d) Wilhelm, Duke of Styria and Carinthia, etc (1370-Vienna 15 Jul 1406; bur St.Stephan, Vienna); m.Vienna 13 Oct/13 Nov 1401 Queen Joanna II of Naples (d.Naples 2 Feb 1435)

2d) Leopold IV "der Stolze" Duke of Styria, etc, ruler of the territiories in Alsace (1371-Vienna 3 Jun 1411; bur St.Stephan, Vienna); m.Vienna 15 Aug 1393 Catherine (1378-26 Jan 1425; bur Carthusian cloister, Dijon)m dau of Philippe, Duc de Bourgogne (and later wife of Smassmann von Rappoltstein)

3d) Ernst I "der Eiserne" Duke of Styria, etc (Bruck an der Muhr 1377-Bruck 10 Jun 1424; bur Rein); m.1st Bruck 1392 Margarete (d.Bruck 1407/10; bur Rein), dau of Duke Bogislav V of Pomerania; m.2nd Cracow 25 Jan 1412 Zimburg (d.Türnitz 28 Sep 1429; bur Lilienfeld Stiftskirche), dau of Siemowit of Masovia, Pr of Plock

1e) Friedrich V, Duke of Austria, became Emperor Friedrich III in 1452 (Innsbruck21 Sep 1415-Linz19 Aug 1493, bur St.Stephan, Vienna); m.Rome 16 Mar 1452 Leonor (Torres Vedras 18 Sep 1436-Wiener Neustadt 3 Sep 1476, bur St.Trinitatis, Wiener Neustadt), dau of King Duarte of Portugal

1f) Christof (Wiener Neustadt 16 Nov 1455-21 Mar 1456; bur Neukloster Kirche, Wiener Neustadt)

2f) Emperor Maximilian I (Burg zu Neustadt 22 Mar 1459-Wels 12 Jan 1519; bur Wiener Neustadt); m.1st Ghent 20 Aug 1477 Marie, heiress of Burgundy and the Netherlands, Duchess of Brabant, Burgundy, Limburg and Luxemburg, Css of Flanders, Artois, Hainaut, Holland, Seeland and Frisia, lady of Malines, Mgvne of Antwerp, etc (Brussels 13 Feb 1457-Bruges 27 Mar 1482; bur Bruges); m.2nd Hall, Tyrol 16 Mar 1494 Blanca Maria (Milan 5 Apr 1472-Innsbruck 31 Dec 1510; bur Stams), dau of Galeazzo Maria Sforza, Duke of Milan; for his descendants see Part 3

3f) Helene (3 Nov 1460-28 Feb 1461, bur Wiener Neustadt Neukloster Kirche)

4f) Kunigunde (Burg zu Wiener Neustadt 16 Mar 1465-Munich6 Aug 1520; bur Munich); m.Innsbruck 3 Jan 1487 Duke Albrecht IV of Bavaria (d.18 Mar 1508)

3f) Johann (9 Aug 1466-10 Feb 1467, bur Wiener Neustadt Neukloster Kirche)

2e) Margarete (Wiener Neustadt 1416/17-Altenburg 12 Feb 1486; bur Altenburg Schloßkirche); m.Leipzig 3 Jun 1431 Elector Friedrich of Saxony (d.4 Sep 1464)

3e) Albrecht VI, Archduke of Austria 1453 (Vienna18 Dec 1418-Vienna2 Dec 1463; bur St.Stephan, Vienna); m.Böblingen Aug 1452 Matilde (Heidelberg7 Mar 1419-Heidelberg22 Aug 1482; bur St.Georg, Tübingen 1554), dau of Ludwig III, Elector Palatine, and widow of Ludwig Gf von Württemberg

4e) Alexander (d.1420; bur Wiener Neustadt)

5e) Rudolf (d.by 1424; bur Wiener Neustadt Dom)

6e) Leopold (d.by 1424; bur Wiener Neustadt Dom)

7e) Katharina (1424-Schloß Hohenbaden 11 Sep 1493, bur Baden-Baden Stiftskirche); m.Pforzheim 15 Jul 1447 Mgve Karl I of Baden (d.24 Feb 1475)

8e) Ernst II (d.10 Aug 1432; bur Wiener Neustadt Dom)

9e) Anna (d.11 Nov 1429; bur Wiener Neustadt Dom)

4d) Elisabeth (1378-1392, bur St.Stephan, Vienna)

5d) Friedrich IV, Duke of Austria in Tyrol 1402, in Laufenburg 1408 (1382-Innsbruck 24 Jun 1439, bur Stams); m.1st Innsbruck 24 Dec 1407 Elisabeth (Amberg by 27 Ocr 1381-Innsbruck 31 Dec 1409, bur Stams), dau of Ruprecht III, Elector Palatine; m.2nd Innsbruck by 11 Jun 1411 Anna (d.Innsbruck 11 Aug 1432; bur Stams), dau of Duke Friedrich of Braunschweig

1e) Elisabeth (27 Dec 1408-28 Dec 1408; bur Stams)

2e) Margarete (1423-6 Jul 1424; bur Stams)

3e) Hedwig (1424-21 Feb 1427; bur Stams)

4e) Wolfgang (b.and d.26 Feb 1426; bur Stams)

5e) Sigismund, Archduke of Austria (Innsbruck 26 Oct 1427-Innsbruck 4 Mar 1496, bur Stams); he inherited 1450 the family territories in Swabia and Switzerland; m.1st 12 Feb 1449 Eleanor (Dunfermline 1433-Innsbruck 20 Nov 1480, bur Stams), dau of James I, King of Scots; m.2nd Innsbruck 24 Feb 1484 Katharina (Meissen 24 Jul 1468-Göttingen 10 Feb 1524, bur Münden), dau of Duke Albrecht of Saxony (and later wife of Duke Erich of Braunschweig)

1f) Wolfgang (b.and d.1480; bur Stams)

6d) Katharina, Abbess of St. Klara, Vienna (1385- )

7b) Heinrich (1299-Bruck an der Mur 3 Feb 1327; bur Graz Minoritenkirche, later Königsfelden); m.Oct 1314 Elisabeth (d.Königsfelden 14 Sep 1343; bur Königsfelden), dau of Ruprecht Gf von Virneburg

8b) Meinhard (b.ca 1300, d.young; bur Tulln)

9b) Otto, Duke of Austria & Styria 1330, Duke of Carinthia, Carniola & South Tyrol 1335 (Vienna 23 Jul 1301-Vienna 26 Feb 1339; bur Augustinerkirche, Vienna, later Neuberg im Mürztal); m.1st Straubing 15 May 1325 Elisabeth (1306-Vienna 25 Mar 1330; nur Neuberg), dau of Duke Stephan of Bavaria; m.2nd Znaim Feb 1335 Anna (Cham 27 Mar 1323-3 Sep 1338; bur Neuberg), dau of Johann von Luxemburg, King of Bohemia

1c) Friedrich II (10 Feb 1327-11 Dec 1344; bur Neuberg)

2c) Leopold II (1328-10 Aug 1344; bur Neuberg)

3c) [illegitimate] Otto, d.after 6 Dec 1330

4c) [illegitimate] Leopold, d.after 6 Dec 1330

5c) [illegitimate] Johann, d.after 6 Oct 1338

6c) [illegitimate] Leopold, d.after 6 Oct 1338

10b) Elisabeth (d.19 May 1353, bur St.Georges, Nancy, then Königsfelden); m.Duke Frederick IV of Lorraine (d.Paris 21 Apr 1329)

11b) Katharina (Oct 1295-Naples 18 Jan 1323; bur S.Lorenzo, Naples); m.1316 Carlo of Naples, Duke of Calabria (d.Naples 10 Nov 1328)

12b) Jutta (d.Vienna Mar 1329; bur Königsfelden); m.Baden 26 Apr 1319 Ludwig Gf von Oettingen (d.Weitra 29 Sep 1346)

3a) Katharina (1256-Landshut 4 Apr 1282; bur Seligenthal); m.Vienna Jan 1279 Duke Otto III of Bavaria (d.Landshut 9 Sep 1312)

4a) Agnes (ca 1257-Wittenberg 11 Oct 1322; bur Wittenberg); m.1273 Duke Albrecht II of Saxony (d.1298)

5a) Klementia (ca 1262-d.after 7 Feb 1293; bur S.Domenico Maggiore, Naples); m.Vienna Jan 1281 King Charles I Martell of Hungary (d.Naples 12 Aug 1295)

6a) Hartmann (Rheinfelden 1263-drowned at Rheinau 21 Dec 1281; bur Basel Münster)

7a) Rudolf II, Duke of Austria 1283, Duke of Swabia 1282 (1270-Prague 10 May 1290; bur PragueCastle); m.Mar 1289 Agnes (5 Sep 1269-Prague17 May 1296; bur St.Klara, Prague), dau of King Ottokar Premysl of Bohemia

1b) Johann, outlawed as the murderer of King Albrecht I (1290-13 Dec 1313, bur S.Niccolò, Pisa)

8a) Hedwig (d.1285/6); m.Vienna Oct 1270 Mgve Otto VI of Brandenburg (d.6 Jul 1303)

9a) Jutta=Bona (13 Mar 1271-Prague18 Jun 1297; bur St.Veit, Prague); m.Eger 24 Jan 1285 King Wenzel II of Bohemia (d.Prague 21 Jun 1305)

10a) [illegitimate] Albrecht I von Schenkenberg, Gf von Löwenstein, d.1304; m.24 Jul 1284 Liutgard von Bolanden (d.1324/5)

1b) Philipp, d.by 13 Sep 1310; m.Adelheid von Weinsberg

2b) Rudolf, d.1328/9

3b) Nikolaus, d.13 Mar 1340; m.Williberg von Wertheim (d.1333)

1c) Rudolf, a canon in Würzburg

2c) Albrecht, d.by 20 May 1382; m.1st ca 1355 Mechtild Schenkin von Limpurg (dsp); m.2nd by 20 Sep 1369 Udilhild von Werdenberg

1d) Albrecht, k.a.Döffingen 30 Aug 1388

2d) Georg, d.Bamberg 10 Aug 1464

3d) Heinrich, d.1444; m.by 8 Feb 1408 Anna Schenkin von Erbach (d.1444)

4d) Rudolf fl 1382/95

5d) Hans fl 1382

4b) Anna, d.after 7 May 1338; m.by 2 Sep 1309 Ulrich II Gf von Tübingen (d.ca 1341)
